conclusion: Analyze refraction problem to determine if O₁ is to the right of O.
Solid horizontal line is boundary between air and water.
Beam of blue light travels from point A in air, hits boundary at O₁, then travels through water to point B.
Point O is intersection of line AB with boundary.
Need to determine if O₁ is to the right of O.
Light bends toward normal when passing from air to water due to refraction.
Light travels slower in water than in air.
Refraction depends on refractive indices of air and water.
Dashed line shows straight line path without refraction.
Point O is where straight line AB crosses boundary.
Actual path of light is represented by red line segments AO₁ and O₁B.
O₁ is the actual refraction point on the boundary.
Bent path AO₁B shows O₁ is to the right of O.
Light bends toward normal when entering water, hitting boundary at O₁ different from straight line crossing at O.
Refraction point O₁ must be to the right of O due to bending toward normal.
Second image shows O₁ positioned to the right of O along boundary.
Yes, O₁ is to the right of O due to Snell's Law and refraction from air to water.
